message: I must have fallen asleep at some point.
I'm not sure how long I slept, but the exhaustion and nausea have vanished.
I sit up slowly, taking care not to knock Ren off the bed.
Then I get out of bed and chug down the water Koujaku left on the table.
I'm a lot thirstier than I realized. I leave the room in search of something else to drink.
Though I'm still a little dizzy, I can walk well enough.
While drinking a glass of water from the bar, I hear some noise downstairs.
It sounds like running water. Koujaku, probably. Maybe he's drawing a bath.
...I know I should go apologize to him. I can't stand the thought of leaving things like that.
We still have so much facing us ahead...
I head downstairs and to the bathroom, but stop myself just as I reach for the doorknob.
The door isn't closed all the way, and I catch a glimpse of bright colors through the gap. It isn't the color of Koujaku's kimono.
Wait, what is that?
Holding my breath, I lean closer, opening the door just a little more to get a better look.
Koujaku is inside, washing his kimono in the sink. His back is to me, so he hasn't noticed my presence.
His back...<K> I can't take my eyes off it.
A tattoo blooms there, a field of bright red flowers. The colors are so vivid that they look almost real.
It's incredible―a work of art―but what it's what else I see that shocks me to my core.
His whole body is covered with scars. I've never seen any of this before.
When Koujaku returned to the island, I noticed the scars on his hands and face. I asked him if he'd been in a fight.
He dismissed it with a laugh, and we never spoke of it again.
The tattoo on his chest was new as well, but that was just a normal tattoo, so I never thought much of it.
The scars I can see on him now are faint, faded. They must be very old.
Where did he get all those scars? On the mainland, obviously. The same place he must have gotten that tattoo.
This... isn't the Koujaku I know.
Maybe that's only natural. He spent years away from the island―away from me. Anything could have happened in that time.
But I forgot all about that. I convinced myself I knew all there was to know.
In truth, the only Koujaku I really know is the child who left all those years ago.
This Koujaku is someone else.
I step away from the door, seized by an indescribable feeling of loss.
When I finally realize I've been holding my breath, I let out a quiet sigh.
Then I trudge back up the stairs and collapse into bed.
That tattoo on Koujaku's back. Those scars.
I can't think about anything else.
I close my eyes, trying to calm myself down, but my door opens only moments later.
...Koujaku.
I roll over to face the wall.
I can't bear to let him see my face. Not now.

name: 紅雀
message: "They've got a dryer in the bathroom. Talk about convenient. My clothes are done already."
He sounds totally normal.
I know that I should follow his lead and act like nothing has changed.
But... <K>I can't.
Still facing the wall, I speak.

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Koujaku."

name: 紅雀
message: "Hm?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "So, um..."

name: 紅雀
message: "What is it?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "What are you hiding from me?"

name: 紅雀
message: "...Huh? Where'd that come from?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Just tell me."

name: 蒼葉
message: "I... don't know if I can trust you anymore. I don't know what to believe. I feel like I don't even know you."
...No. This isn't what I want to say.
I don't even know what I want to say... and still, my mouth keeps moving.

name: 蒼葉
message: "I don't know anything about your time off the island. I wanted to, but I never knew how to ask..."

name: 蒼葉
message: "We've got a lot on our plate right now. We don't have time to waste, but..."

name: 蒼葉
message: "...I can't trust you. I'm not even sure you trust me."

name: 紅雀
message: "Aoba..."
Suddenly overcome with panic, I sit up and turn to face Koujaku.
He's staring at his feet with a solemn look on his face. The sight triggers a pang of guilt.
Just as I open my mouth to explain, Koujaku speaks first.

name: 紅雀
message: "I just..."

name: 紅雀
message: "I just... can't tell you. I'm sorry..."
I sense both concern and rejection in his words.

name: 紅雀
message: "I know I'm hurting you. Makes me want to punch myself in the face. Honestly, I can't blame you if you don't trust me."

name: 紅雀
message: "But I want you to know that I really am trying to protect you."

name: 紅雀
message: "If I can convince you to believe one thing, believe that. I know that probably sounds like bullshit to you right now, but... please, I'm begging you."

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Fine."
There's nothing else I can say, nothing that will get through.
The wall between us is too strong. My words barely scratched the surface.
"I can't tell you," he said. That's all there is to it.

name: 紅雀
message: "I'm sorry, man. You should probably get some sleep. I'll be right next door, so call if you need anything."

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Sure."

name: 紅雀
message: "...Night."
The sound of the door closing thunders in my ears.
I squeeze my eyes closed and mash my face into the comforter.
Koujaku is trying to protect me, and I want to trust him. We should be on the same page, but somehow, we keep slipping past each other.
Why does it bother me so much? I have more important things to worry about, don't I?
We came here for a reason. I need to keep my head in the game.
Of course, that's easier said than done.
With all the awful things I said to Koujaku, aren't I the one forgetting our mission here?
Guilt and self-loathing wash over me, and all I can do is curse.
